podcast_summary: Hey there, podcast enthusiasts! We have an exciting new episode downloaded on our Podcast Platform, and you don't want to miss it. In this episode, We Wow on the Weekend, hosts Dennis and Reggie indulge in some Q&A with listeners, answering questions like "Are there fires on other planets?" and "How do pianos work?" They also share a mind-bending riddle and discover the contagious power of laughter. Did you know that laughter can spread just like a cold or flu? It's true! Find out how laughter affects us and why it's so good for our health. Plus, learn about a unique study that combined laughter and exercise to boost strength and memory in older adults. This episode is guaranteed to put a smile on your face and leave you feeling energized. So, head over to our Podcast Platform and tune in to the latest episode of We Wow on the Weekend. Get ready to be wowed!
podcast_guest:
Guy Raz (; born November 9, 1975) is a  podcast host and creator. His shows include How I Built This, The Great Creators, Wow in the World, Wisdom from the Top, and several others. He has been described by The New York Times as "one of the most popular podcasters in history" and his podcasts have a combined monthly audience of 19.2 million downloads.He is also the founder of the audio company Built-It Productions that produces many of his programs and the co-founder of Tinkercast, a children’s media company. Raz worked as a host and correspondent for National Public Radio (NPR). In 2000, at age 25, he was appointed NPR’s Berlin bureau chief–the youngest overseas-based bureau chief in NPR history. As a war correspondent, Raz covered conflicts in Kosovo, Macedonia, Afghanistan, and Iraq. He was also CNN’s correspondent in Jerusalem from 2004-2006. He has reported from more than 45 countries.His book How I Built This was a New York Times and Wall Street Journal bestseller and has been translated into 16 languages. He is also the co-author (with Mindy Thomas) of several children’s books including the #1 New York Times bestseller, The How and Wow of the Human Body.
Raz has appeared on The Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon on five occasions.

Here are the main insights from the podcast:

1. The podcast starts with an introduction and promotion of Wow in the World on YouTube.
2. The hosts, Dennis and Reggie, answer questions from listeners, such as whether there are fires on other planets and how pianos work.
3. They discuss the concept of contagion, where behaviors and emotions like laughter, yawning, and shivering can spread from one person to another.
4. Cognitive neuroscientist Sophie Scott is mentioned as an expert on laughter and how it can affect us. Laughing releases neurotransmitters like dopamine and serotonin, which make us feel happier and more focused.
5. The hosts mention a study from Georgia State University where older adults were asked to laugh while exercising. This combination of laughter and exercise helped them become healthier and improved their memory.
6. The episode ends with the hosts attempting to stop laughing and balance out their emotions by thinking of sad things and renaming plants in the backyard.
